title: Real Madrid defender Pepe considering two offers to join Chinese Super League
text:
double dilemma Real Madrid defender Pepe considering two offers to join Chinese Super League 
Brazilian ace has huge deals on table to swap the Bernabeu for life in the emerging Far East league By DUNCAN WRIGHT Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments REAL MADRID defender Pepe is weighing up two big-money offers to quit Spain and join the Chinese Super League. 
The 33-year-old is still a key part of the Real defence at the Bernabeu but knows he is approaching the last few years of his career at the top level. Getty Images 3 Pepe is deciding whether to quit Real Madrid for the Chinese Super League 
And while real stall on offering him a new deal as they look to bring through new players, Pepe has been the subject of approaches from two clubs in China. 
They would be willing to pay Pepe more than £20million-a-year to quit La Liga and join the ever-growing list of players who have decided to move to the Far East. AP:Associated Press 3 Pepe celebrates winning the FIFA Club World Cup with Cristiano Ronaldo 
Carlos Tevez last week made the move to Shanghai Shenhua in a deal that makes him the highest paid player in world football on a staggering £615,000-a-week. 
He joins former Chelsea striker Oscar out in Shanghai after he completed a £52milion move from Stamford Bridge earlier in the month. 
And the money is set to continue to be put on the table as the Chinese game shows no sign of slowing up in their quest to build a powerful professional game in the country. 
Jorge Mendes, the agent of Cristiano Ronaldo , says the Real Madrid star has rejected a £257million move to China this season in favour of staying in Spain. Reuters Pepe helped Portugal to the European Championship over the summer SunSport's Justin Allen goes to check out the Chinese Super League 
And now his Real teammate Pepe has a decision to make over whether he remains in one of the world's best leagues, or decides to cash in on the huge money on offer for the final few years of his career. 
According to Spanish paper Marca , one of the biggest factors will be whether moving to China would damage his chances of being part of the Portugal squad in the 2018 World Cup in Russia.
